message: Now that my wife found a cruise vaca for us, I need to find a way to sneak some alcohol onto the ship. Any ideas?

If I remember correctly, your allowed to bring a certain amount on the ship.  Find out what the amount is and buy it at your first port of call.  I remember buying local tequila in mexico and rum in Jamaica and bringing it on to the ship.  If you get more than the allowed number of bottles per person, they hold it for you until the end of the trip.

Also, if you buy liquor at most of the bigger tourist spots, they'll send the liquor directly to the ship. Otherwise, they take it when you get back on the boat. IIRC, the duty-free limit to bring back is 750ml per person. You can bring back more, but you have to pay a couple bucks.

Just went on a cruise in January. Friends/family all advised dumping out water/shampoo bottles (and thoroughly washing) to fill with liquor. We didn't - we just brought a couple bottles of wine. Funny thing though - we only drank one of the two. We just went to the bars the rest of the time.
